text:
This forces browser to reload images everytime. If I have a directory with
images, the server doesn't send expires header, so when reloading the page,
browser sends a conditional get, receiving a 304.

AS apache, we need a configuration parameter to determine the expiration lap of
static content.
creator: vicentesalvador@netscape.net

text: This is an enhancement request rather than an actual bug.
creator: medthomas@ntlworld.com

text: It seems this functionality is already present with the use of ExpiresFilter (which is new to Tomcat7) and more powerful than the existing patch.

creator: cleclerc@apache.org
text:
FYI, a standalone version of ExpiresFilter is available and deployable in your webapps on older Tomcat versions (6, 5.5, etc) as well as on other Java EE servers (Websphere, Weblogic, etc).

It is available under Apache Software Licence 2 at http://code.google.com/p/xebia-france/wiki/ExpiresFilter . It solely depends on Java 5 (generics) and SLF4J (you can modify the source to rely on any other logging framework).

Hope this helps,

Cyrille
